Puigdemont replica a la promesa de Sánchez de traerlo de vuelta a España: "¿Usted me quiere secuestrar?"
05 Nov 2019, 14:15 by Arturo Puente
El líder de JxCat pregunta a Sánchez si está pensando en cometer actos ilegales después de que este prometiese traerlo de vuelta a España
El expresident asegura que Sánchez solo puede cumplir su compromiso mediante el secuestro o tomando desde el Ejecutivo decisiones del Judicial



"¿Usted está pensando en secuestrarme, señor Sánchez?". Con esta lacónica pregunta ha respondido Carles Puigdemont a la promesa hecha este lunes por el presidente del Gobierno en funciones, Pedro Sánchez, que aseguró en el debate de candidatos que se encargaría de traer a Puigdemont de vuelta a España para ponerlo en disposición de la justicia. 
"Sólo tiene dos maneras de cumplir su promesa electoral, y las dos son ilegales: Tomar las decisiones del poder judicial desde el Consejo de Ministros o volver al secuestro de personas, como hacían dirigentes de su partido en el pasado", ha asegurado Puigdemont desde un videomensaje difundido este martes desde Waterloo, en Béliga, donde el líder de JxCat tiene fijada su residencia.
"La otra opción", ha asegurado Puigdemont, "es la que un ministro y otros dirigentes de su partido ya practicaron en el pasado y que usted seguramente justifica: el secuestro de personas", le ha acusado con dureza el líder de JxCat, en referencia al terrorismo de Estado de los GAL. "¿Usted necesita exhibir mi cabeza como un trofeo bárbaro para arañar unos votos que no acaba de tener?", le ha preguntado.
Puigdemont continúa su alocución agradeciendo a Sánchez que haya sido tan "franco", pues a su entender esta promesa electoral refuerza uno de los argumentos de su defensa en Bélgica. "En España no hay separación de poderes", ha proclamado, "y como consecuencia yo no podría tener un juicio justo, y menos cuando mi cabeza se convierte en un reclamo electoral", ha dicho el expresident.

Puigdemont replies to Sánchez's promise to bring him back to Spain: "Do you want to kidnap me?"
05 Nov 2019, 14:15 by Arturo Puente
The leader of JxCat asks Sanchez if he is thinking of committing illegal acts after he promised to bring him back to Spain
The expresident assures that Sanchez can only fulfill his commitment through kidnapping or taking decisions from the Judiciary from the Executive



"Are you thinking of kidnapping me, Mr. Sanchez?" With this laconic question, Carles Puigdemont has responded to the promise made on Monday by the president of the acting Government, Pedro Sánchez, who assured in the debate of candidates that he would be responsible for bringing Puigdemont back to Spain to make it available to justice .
"He has only two ways to fulfill his electoral promise, and both are illegal: Take the decisions of the judiciary from the Council of Ministers or return to the kidnapping of people, as did leaders of his party in the past," said Puigdemont from a video message broadcast on Tuesday from Waterloo, in Béliga, where the leader of JxCat has his residence set.
"The other option," said Puigdemont, "is the one that a minister and other leaders of his party have already practiced in the past and that you surely justify: the kidnapping of people," the leader of JxCat has accused him, in reference to the terrorism of the GAL State. "Do you need to display my head like a barbaric trophy to scratch a few votes that you don't just have?" He asked.
Puigdemont continues his speech thanking Sanchez that he has been so "frank", because in his opinion this electoral promise reinforces one of the arguments of his defense in Belgium. "In Spain there is no separation of powers," he has proclaimed, "and as a consequence I could not have a fair trial, especially when my head becomes an electoral claim," said the expresident.
